definition: stray dog (idiom)
to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged
mourning/funeral/(old) corpse

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 傢伙|家伙[jia1 huo5]
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
dog/Kangxi radical 94

sentences.english: All last night the wind howled like a stray dog, and the rain still pours on without a break.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚，风如丧家之犬般咆哮了一夜，雨也下个不停。

sentences.english: They are like a begging of the dog.
sentences.chinese: 他们就象一只摇尾乞怜的丧家之犬。

definition: see 喪家之犬|丧家之犬[sang4 jia1 zhi1 quan3]
to cover one's head and sneak away like a rat (idiom); to flee ignominiously
ruined army, defeated general (idiom); scattered remnants
lit. a bird startled by the mere twang of a bow (idiom)/fig. sb who frightens easily, due to past experiences
variant of 倉皇|仓皇[cang1 huang2]
to flee/to run away
lit. there is no road to the sky, nor door into the earth (idiom)/fig. to be at the end of one's rope/to be trapped in a hopeless situation
pinyin: shang4 tian1 wu2 lu4 , ru4 di4 wu2 men2

definition: to flee in defeat/to bolt
in a panic/flurried
to drift and live without purpose (idiom); to drag out an ignoble existence
to scamper off/to scurry off like a frightened rat
to flee/to go into exile (from prison)
to flee at the mere sight of (idiom)
to piss in one's pants in terror (idiom); scared witless
to flee in disorder/to scurry off
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
